sen.j: 皇室の儀式では天皇及び宮家に関する様々な儀式について記す。
sen.e: Various ceremonies associated with the emperor and Miyake (families allowed to be in status of Imperial family) are described below.

sen.j: 賜剣の儀（しけんのぎ）
sen.e: Shiken no gi

sen.j: 天皇家及び宮家に子供が生まれた際に、天皇から子供の健やかな成長を願い子を守る目的の守り刀を授かる儀式。
sen.e: A ceremony in which the emperor gives a a sword for protection to a child born to the imperial family or Miyake to protect the child in prayer for healthy growth.

sen.j: 短刀は白木の鞘で赤い布に包まれ桐箱に入れられ、宮中で天皇の意思を受けた使者（勅使）に託される。
sen.e: A short sword in a plain wood sheath is wrapped in a red cloth and put in a paulownia box, which is passed to an imperial envoy who received an order of the emperor in the imperial court.

sen.e: A ceremony in which a Japanese paper with a name of the child written in calligraphy on it and a Japanese paper with an 'oshirushi (symbol)' printed on goods that the child will use are put in a paulownia box and placed next to the child's pillow on the seventh day from the birth of the child.
